intro: Eriosema brevipes, commonly known as the short-stemmed eriosema, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive leaf structure and clusters of small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in grassland habitats and is adapted to dry conditions. Its small, hairy leaves and yellow to orange flowers make it easily identifiable. Eriosema brevipes is often found in open areas and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
